definition: surname Rao
rich/abundant/exuberant/to add for free/to throw in as bonus/to spare/to forgive/despite/although
"to eat" or "food" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 184)
surname Yao/Yao or Tang Yao (c. 2200 BC), one of Five legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], second son of Di Ku 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]
not to overlook, nor spare (idiom); unwilling to forgive/to treat severely without listening to excuses
full of (interest, humor, sentiment etc)
Shangrao prefecture level city and county in Jiangxi
to beg forgiveness
talkative/to blather/to shoot one's mouth off/rap (genre of music)
Shangrao prefecture level city in Jiangxi
to forgive/to pardon/to spare
Raoping county in Chaozhou 潮州[Chao2 zhou1], Guangdong
Raoping county in Chaozhou 潮州[Chao2 zhou1], Guangdong
Shangrao county in Shangrao 上饒|上饶, Jiangxi
Guanrao county in Dongying 東營|东营[Dong1 ying2], Shandong
Guanrao county in Dongying 東營|东营[Dong1 ying2], Shandong
to be rich in (some quality or other)
to spare sb's life

sentences.english: Is one thing she liked the strike, and spare, like a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 就是有一点她挺喜欢罢课，和饶老师一样。

sentences.english: Willoughby's boast of his implacable character was to blame.
sentences.chinese: 威洛比吹嘘过他不饶人的性格，他应该受到谴责。

sentences.english: He knelt in front of Zheng Laozhi and pleaded for his life.
sentences.chinese: 他跪在郑老志的面前，求他饶他一命。
加里古拉饶了那奴隶的命。

sentences.english: We should learn to forgive others in life when we are in the right.
sentences.chinese: 我们在生活中应该学会得理饶人。

sentences.english: Oh ! Pray have mercy on me, and do not make me steal.
sentences.chinese: 哦，请饶了我吧，不要逼我做贼。

sentences.english: XuanZu night jeong cheol, recall the past, and ultimately spared his life.
sentences.chinese: 宣祖夜访郑澈，回忆往昔，最终饶了他的性命。

sentences.english: Drop your weapon, I'll spare life.
The book takes a slight detour and discusses design principles in more detail.
sentences.chinese: 该书饶了一段路，并且更详细地讨论设计原则。

sentences.english: Anh yeu em rat nhieu he he integrity of the source code can be used directly.
sentences.chinese: 英宇时间大鼠饶他，他的完整的源代码可以直接使用。

sentences.english: "Hold on," said he, "I'll give you the rope to boot."
sentences.chinese: “拿着，”他说，“我还外饶你这根绳子。”

sentences.english: I will let you off this time. Do not let it happen again.
sentences.chinese: 这次我就饶了你，但下不为例。

sentences.english: That child! Whatever you said, he simply wouldn't listen.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子，饶怎么说他也不听。

sentences.english: They give you life, and that's what they take - all of it that counts, anyway.
sentences.chinese: 他们饶你一命，但是却夺走你生命中所有重要的东西。

sentences.english: God, you told me to spare you? What if this is.
sentences.chinese: 上帝，你在叫我饶了你？什么话这是。

definition: were it not for/if not for
to pardon/to excuse/to forgive
to show understanding/to excuse/to presume/to expect
I'm afraid that.../perhaps/maybe/very likely
(in the expression 看在…的份上) for the sake of .../considering ...
to beg forgiveness
to forgive easily/to let off lightly (often with negative: you won't get away with it)
resolute/definitive/categorically/absolutely
lit. start off leniently (idiom); please do not be too strict with me/Do not judge me too harshly./Look favorably on my humble efforts.
suffering/hardship/living hell
to beg for mercy
to speculate/to ponder
fortunately/luckily/(sarcastic) fancy that, how fortunate!
if it were not for/but for
hands tied and waiting to be captured
certainly/of course
